intro: Elaphrium pilosum, commonly known as the hairy elaphrium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a compact, bushy appearance. Its small, white or yellowish flowers are arranged in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Elaphrium pilosum is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
